full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 238 of 247 397 LBUCmax7
at a high level of cross and what might be identified so we can troubleshoot these issues in advance in order to work on a solution that avoids wasting the jury's time and, most importantly, jeopardizing the privacy of a crime victim. We have previously reached out to defense to ask to confer about some of these issues. We would like to do that this evening. I am concerned that there may be topics that are identifying as to this victim and we would be happy to talk it through with defense counsel and work out a solution about anonymizing names or other issues as we continued all along in this case. So we ask the Court to direct the parties to meet and confer on that issue given the steaks of that issue in this case.
THE COURT: Ms. Menninger, the witness is on cross, so they can't confer with the witness. Any reason not to do that?
MS. MENNINGER: Your Honor, I see no reason not to confer with the government about a way that we can accommodate this.
THE COURT: You can do that. If you have different views, you'll raise them with me by letter tonight if you come to a point of disagreement. Okay?
MS. MOE: Thank you, your Honor.
MS. MENNINGER: Thank you.
THE COURT: Anything else?
MS. MENNINGER: Not from us, your Honor. Thank you.
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
